conclusion: Square coil with n turns and side length a is placed perpendicular to a uniform magnetic field, with half in the field.
Magnetic field magnitude increases uniformly from B to 2B in time interval Δt.
Need to find the electromotive force (EMF) induced in the coil.
Recall Faraday's law of induction: ε = -n * (ΔΦ)/Δt.
Magnetic flux Φ through one turn is given by Φ = B * A.
Effective area experiencing the magnetic field is half of the total area of the coil.
Area of the coil is a², so effective area is (1/2) a².
Magnetic flux through the coil is Φ = B * (1/2 a²).
Change in magnetic flux ΔΦ is (1/2) B a².
Plugging into Faraday's law: ε = -n * (B a²)/(2 Δt).
Induced EMF is ε = n * (B a²)/(2 Δt).
Magnetic field increases uniformly, rate of change is B/Δt.
Rate of change of magnetic flux is (1/2) B a² / Δt.
According to Faraday's law: ε = -n * (B a²)/(2 Δt).
Reaffirm that only half the area contributes to the flux.
If entire coil were in the field, change in flux would be B a².
Since only half is in the field, change in flux is (1/2) B a².
Induced EMF is ε = n * (B a²)/(2 Δt).
